Porcelain Veneers

These are thin layers bonded directly to a damaged tooth to help achieve a natural looking smile. This is ideal for minor chips or cracks in teeth.

Transform Your Smile

These are thin layers bonded directly to a damaged tooth to help achieve a natural looking smile. This is ideal for minor chips or cracks in teeth. Porcelain veneers can also address discoloration, gaps, and shape irregularities for a perfect smile makeover.

What Are Porcelain Veneers?

Porcelain veneers are ultra-thin, custom-made shells crafted from high-quality dental porcelain. They're designed to cover the front surface of teeth, transforming their color, shape, size, and overall appearance. Each veneer is individually crafted to match your desired smile.

Key Characteristics

  • Ultra-thin: Only 0.5-0.7mm thick (like a contact lens)
  • Natural-looking: Mimics light reflection of real teeth
  • Stain-resistant: High-quality porcelain resists discoloration
  • Custom-made: Each veneer designed specifically for you
  • Durable: Can last 10-15+ years with proper care

Conditions Veneers Can Address

Cosmetic Concerns

  • •

    Chips and Cracks

    Minor damage from accidents or wear

  • •

    Discoloration

    Stains that don't respond to whitening

  • •

    Gaps Between Teeth

    Small spaces that affect smile appearance

  • •

    Worn Down Teeth

    Age-related wear or grinding damage

Shape & Size Issues

  • •

    Misshapen Teeth

    Irregular or asymmetrical tooth shapes

  • •

    Small or Short Teeth

    Teeth that appear too small for the smile

  • •

    Minor Misalignment

    Slightly crooked teeth in visible areas

  • •

    Uneven Tooth Lengths

    Creating a more uniform smile line

The Veneer Process

1

Consultation & Planning

We discuss your goals, examine your teeth, and take photos and impressions. Using digital smile design, we show you exactly how your new smile will look before treatment begins.

Smile preview: See your results before committing to treatment
2

Tooth Preparation

A thin layer of enamel (about 0.5mm) is gently removed from the front of each tooth to make room for the veneer. Local anesthetic ensures your comfort during this process.

Minimal preparation: Preserves most of your natural tooth structure
3

Impressions & Temporaries

Precise impressions are taken and sent to our lab. Temporary veneers protect your teeth and give you a preview of your new smile while permanent veneers are being crafted.

Lab time: 1-2 weeks to create your custom porcelain veneers
4

Bonding & Final Adjustments

Your custom veneers are carefully fitted, adjusted for perfect bite and appearance, then permanently bonded to your teeth using advanced adhesive technology.

Immediate results: See your transformation right away

Veneers vs. Other Cosmetic Options

Treatment Best For Longevity Tooth Preparation Cost Range
Porcelain Veneers Comprehensive smile makeovers 10-15+ years Minimal removal $800-2000 per tooth
Teeth Whitening Discoloration only 1-3 years None $300-800
Dental Bonding Minor chips, small gaps 3-7 years Minimal/None $150-400 per tooth
Dental Crowns Heavily damaged teeth 10-20 years Significant removal $800-1500 per tooth
Invisalign Alignment issues Permanent results None $3000-8000 total

Caring for Your Veneers

Daily Care

  • Brush with non-abrasive toothpaste
  • Floss daily to prevent gum disease
  • Use an alcohol-free mouthwash
  • Regular dental checkups and cleanings

Things to Avoid

  • Biting or chewing on hard objects (ice, pens)
  • Using teeth as tools to open packages
  • Grinding or clenching teeth (wear a night guard)
  • Excessive alcohol consumption (can weaken bond)

Investment in Your Smile

Value Considerations

While veneers represent a significant investment, they offer exceptional value when you consider their longevity, natural appearance, and the confidence boost they provide.

Long-term Investment

With proper care, veneers can last 10-15+ years, making the cost per year very reasonable

Immediate Transformation

Unlike other treatments that take months, you see dramatic results immediately

Financing Options

  • Payment plans available to spread cost over time
  • Dental financing through third-party providers
  • FSA/HSA funds can often be used for cosmetic dentistry
  • Package discounts available for multiple veneers

Free consultation: We'll provide a detailed treatment plan and cost estimate

Create Your Dream Smile

Porcelain veneers offer the most dramatic and natural-looking smile transformation available. If you're ready to achieve the smile you've always wanted, let's discuss how veneers can help you reach your goals.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know if I'm a good candidate for veneers?

Good candidates have healthy teeth and gums, realistic expectations, and cosmetic concerns that veneers can address. You should have sufficient enamel for bonding and good oral hygiene habits. A consultation will determine if veneers are right for you.

Do veneers look natural?

High-quality porcelain veneers are virtually indistinguishable from natural teeth. They reflect light naturally, have realistic translucency, and can be customized to match your desired shade and shape. Most people won't know you have veneers unless you tell them.

Can veneers be whitened if they get stained?

Porcelain veneers resist staining much better than natural teeth, but they cannot be whitened with traditional bleaching if they do become discolored. This is why it's important to choose your desired shade carefully. Severe staining may require veneer replacement.

What if a veneer chips or breaks?

Small chips can sometimes be polished or bonded, but larger damage usually requires veneer replacement. This is why we recommend avoiding hard foods and wearing a night guard if you grind your teeth. With proper care, damage is rare.
